meanings.definition: Agreement in action, opinion, feeling, etc.; accord.
meanings.sent1: The band played in perfect harmony, each member working together smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The choir sang in beautiful harmony, creating a lovely melody.
meanings.sent3: The animals in the forest lived in harmony, having a peaceful coexistence.
meanings.sent4: The colors in the painting blended in harmony, creating a stunning visual effect.
meanings.sent5: The community thrived in harmony, with everyone supporting each other.

meanings.definition: A consistent, orderly, or pleasing arrangement of parts; congruity.
meanings.sent1: The garden was designed with harmony in mind, each plant complementing the others.
meanings.sent2: The interior of the house was decorated with harmony, creating a sense of balance.
meanings.sent3: The flavors in the dish combined in harmony, creating a delicious taste.
meanings.sent4: The elements of the outfit matched in harmony, making a stylish ensemble.
meanings.sent5: The music was composed with harmony, each note blending seamlessly with the next.
